title: [bug] support cudnn.benchmark with 3D convolution
body_html:
When turn on the cudnn.benchmark to run a 3D network, pytorch will report an error like this:

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (77) : an illegal memory access was encountered at /pytorch/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCStorage.cu:66 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error' what(): cuda runtime error (77) : an illegal memory access was encountered at /pytorch/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCStorage.c:182

Pytorch version: 0.2.0.post3 and 0.3.0.post3 with anaconda 2.7
body_text:
When turn on the cudnn.benchmark to run a 3D network, pytorch will report an error like this:
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (77) : an illegal memory access was encountered at /pytorch/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCStorage.cu:66 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error' what():  cuda runtime error (77) : an illegal memory access was encountered at /pytorch/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCStorage.c:182
Pytorch version: 0.2.0.post3 and 0.3.0.post3 with anaconda 2.7
body:
When turn on the `cudnn.benchmark` to run a 3D network, pytorch will report an error like this:

`RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (77) : an illegal memory access was encountered at /pytorch/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCStorage.cu:66
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  cuda runtime error (77) : an illegal memory access was encountered at /pytorch/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCStorage.c:182`

Pytorch version: `0.2.0.post3` and `0.3.0.post3` with anaconda 2.7
